Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, fabric is grey in section, slightly ribbed, interior smeared with a dark-brown resinous substance, with faint traces of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.204-5)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36491) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36491)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 355 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
